other_tests.findings: Acute cholecystitis with hydrops of the gallbladder.

The gallbladder is mildly distended with several multiple stones visible. Positive sonographic ___ sign. No gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. Common bile duct measures 5-7 mm, which is at the top normal. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation. Spleen mildly enlarged at 13 cm.
